definitions.definition: To cause to revolve by turning over and over; to move by turning on an axis; to impel forward by causing to turn over and over on a supporting surface.
definitions.example: To roll a wheel, a ball, or a barrel.

definitions.definition: To turn over and over.
definitions.example: The child will roll on the floor.

definitions.definition: To tumble in gymnastics; to do a somersault.
To wrap (something) round on itself; to form into a spherical or cylindrical body by causing to turn over and over.
definitions.example: To roll a sheet of paper; to roll clay or putty into a ball.

definitions.definition: To bind or involve by winding, as in a bandage; to enwrap; often with up.
definitions.example: To roll up the map for shipping.

definitions.definition: To be wound or formed into a cylinder or ball.
definitions.example: The cloth rolls unevenly; the snow rolls well.

definitions.definition: To drive or impel forward with an easy motion, as of rolling.
definitions.example: This river will roll its waters to the ocean.

definitions.definition: To utter copiously, especially with sounding words; to utter with a deep sound; — often with forth, or out.
definitions.example: To roll forth someone's praises; to roll out sentences.

definitions.definition: To press or level with a roller; to spread or form with a roll, roller, or rollers.
definitions.example: to roll a field;  to roll paste;  to roll steel rails.

definitions.definition: To spread itself under a roller or rolling-pin.
definitions.example: The pastry rolls well.

definitions.definition: To move, or cause to be moved, upon, or by means of, rollers or small wheels.
To leave or begin a journey.
definitions.example: I want to get there early; let's roll.

definitions.definition: To compete, especially with vigor.
definitions.example: OK guys, we're only down by two points. Let's roll!

definitions.definition: To beat with rapid, continuous strokes, as a drum; to sound a roll upon.

To apply (one line or surface) to another without slipping; to bring all the parts of (one line or surface) into successive contact with another, in such a manner that at every instant the parts that have been in contact are equal.
To turn over in one's mind; to revolve.
To behave in a certain way; to adopt a general disposition toward a situation.
definitions.example: I was going to kick his ass, but he wasn't worth getting all worked up over; I don't roll like that.

definitions.definition: To throw dice.
To roll dice such that they form a given pattern or total.
definitions.example: If you roll doubles, you get an extra turn.

definitions.definition: To create a new character in a role-playing game, especially by using dice to determine properties.
definitions.example: I'm gonna go and roll a new shaman tonight.

definitions.definition: To generate a random number.
(of a vessel) To rotate on its fore-and-aft axis, causing its sides to go up and down. Compare with pitch.
(in folk songs) To travel by sailing.
To beat up; to attack and cause physical damage to.
To cause to betray secrets or to testify for the prosecution.
definitions.example: The feds rolled him by giving him a free pass for most of what he'd done.

definitions.definition: To betray secrets.
definitions.example: He rolled on those guys after being in jail two days.

definitions.definition: To be under the influence of MDMA (a psychedelic stimulant, also known as ecstasy).
(of a camera) To (cause to) film.
definitions.example: It's time to roll the cameras.

definitions.definition: To slip past (a defender) with the ball.
To have a rolling aspect.
definitions.example: the hills rolled on

definitions.definition: To perform a periodical revolution; to move onward as with a revolution.
definitions.example: The years roll on.

definitions.definition: To move, like waves or billows, with alternate swell and depression.
To move and cause an effect on someone
To make a loud or heavy rumbling noise.
definitions.example: The thunder rolled and the lightning flashed.

definitions.definition: To utter with an alveolar trill.
definitions.example: Many languages roll their r's.

definitions.definition: To enrobe in toilet-paper (as a prank or spectacle).
definitions.example: The kids rolled the principal's house and yard.

definitions.definition: To create a customized version of.
To engage in sparring in the context of jujitsu or other grappling disciplines.
The act by which something is rolled.
Drunk; intoxicated from alcohol, staggering.
Staggered in time and space; used with blackout, brownout, introduction.
Moving by turning over and over on an axis.
Extending in gentle undulations (of the landscape).
Making a continuous sound.
Civilian naval fleet dedicated to the sea transport of goods and merchandise
An acrylic resin.
A paint containing an acrylic resin.
definitions.example: When it comes to painting, I prefer using acrylics as my medium.

definitions.definition: A painting executed using such a paint.
A thick sheet of plastic.
A liquid coating system based on an acrylic resin
Derived from acrylic acid or acrylonitrile.
Containing an acrylic resin.
An educational institute that teaches applied arts and sciences rather than academic subjects.
An exhibition of objects illustrating many arts.
That teaches applied arts, sciences, technology, engineering and other academic subjects
A service offering telephone calls free of charge to designated numbers.
To call a freephone number.
Someone who blackmails.
A complex vowel sound that begins with the sound of one vowel and ends with the sound of another vowel, in the same syllable.
A vowel digraph or ligature.
A kind of hat with a high conical or cylindrical crown and a saucer-shaped brim, highly embroidered, made of plush felt.
A mixed drink with coffee liqueur and cream.
A series of four consecutive strikes.
A Greek and Turkish dish of fish roe (carp or cod), lemon juice, breadcrumbs, onion, garlic, and olive oil; often served as a meze or with pitta bread
Any of several large carnivorous and carrion-eating birds in the family Accipitridae, having a powerful hooked bill and keen vision.
A gold coin with a face value of ten dollars, formerly used in the United States.
A 13th-century coin minted in Europe and circulated in England as a debased sterling silver penny, outlawed under Edward I.
A score of two under par for a hole.
To score an eagle.
To cause to feel extreme apprehension or unease; to cause to experience horror.
definitions.example: The haunted house was horrifying, from one room to the next I felt more and more like I wasn’t going to survive.

definitions.definition: To grow plump; to swell out.
definitions.example: Her cheeks have plumped.

definitions.definition: To make plump; to fill (out) or support; often with up.
definitions.example: to plump oysters or scallops by placing them in fresh or brackish water

definitions.definition: To cast or let drop all at once, suddenly and heavily.
definitions.example: to plump a stone into water

definitions.definition: To give a plumper (kind of vote).
To give (a vote), as a plumper.
To favor or decide in favor of something.
Having a full and rounded shape; chubby, somewhat overweight.
definitions.example: a plump baby;  plump cheeks

definitions.definition: Fat.
Sudden and without reservation; blunt; direct; downright.
The sound of a sudden heavy fall.
To drop or fall suddenly or heavily, all at once.
Directly; suddenly; perpendicularly.
A knot or cluster; a group; a crowd.
definitions.example: a plump of trees, fowls, or spears

definitions.definition: A venomous snake in the family Viperidae.
A dangerous, treacherous, or malignant person.
A person who smokes marijuana.
A type of sauce, similar to mayonnaise, made from garlic, egg, lemon juice and olive oil.
Any of various insects in the family Formicidae in the order Hymenoptera, typically living in large colonies composed almost entirely of flightless females.
A Web spider.
To rub insects, especially ants, on one's body, perhaps to control parasites or clean feathers.
To collapse or fall
definitions.example: The roof gave in under the weight of the snow.

definitions.definition: To relent, yield, surrender or admit defeat
definitions.example: I finally gave in and let him stay up to watch TV.

definitions.definition: (of a pugilist) to droop the head
A woodwind musical instrument that is closed at both sides to produce an enclosed space, and punctured with finger holes.
A low or mostly-flat sculpture which is carved into a wall, or is in the form of a tile mounted flat to a wall, rather than a fully three-dimensional, free-standing figure.
Refers to any aspect of sculpture which is flat or in the bas relief style.
A military officer who serves as an adjutant to a higher ranking officer, prince or other high political dignitary.
definitions.example: Unlike the orderly or batman, a humble low-ranking servant, an aide-de-camp is often a general, who before the institution of the chief of staff could hold a similar position to his chief.

definitions.definition: One who borrows.
definitions.example: a library borrower's card

definitions.definition: In a stylish manner.
A musical instrument consisting of a thin sheet of metal, or sometimes a saw, usually played with a bow.
To say something in contradiction to.
The characteristics of a society, city etc. which has many different ethnic or national cultures mingling freely; political or social policies which support or encourage such coexistence.
Appearing weak, pale or wan.
Any of various venomous snakes of the family Elapidae.
That part of a circle which a heavenly body appears to pass through as it moves above and below the horizon.
A continuous part of the circumference of a circle (circular arc) or of another curve.
A curve, in general.
A band contained within parallel curves, or something of that shape.
(electrics) A flow of current across an insulating medium; especially a hot, luminous discharge between either two electrodes or as lightning.
A story arc.
A continuous mapping from a real interval (typically [0, 1]) into a space.
A directed edge.
The three-point line.
An arclight.
To move following a curved path.
To shape into an arc; to hold in the form of an arc.
To form an electrical arc.
A quorum
Having a quorum
definitions.example: With only five people able to make it to the meeting, we were barely quorate.

definitions.definition: That which is feminine.
(possibly obsolete) A woman.
(grammar) The feminine gender.
(grammar) A word of the feminine gender.
Of or pertaining to the female gender; womanly.
Of or pertaining to the female sex; biologically female, not male.
Belonging to females; typically used by females.
definitions.example: Mary, Elizabeth, and Edith are feminine names.

definitions.definition: Having the qualities stereotypically associated with women: nurturing, not aggressive.
(grammar) Of, pertaining or belonging to the female grammatical gender, in languages that have gender distinctions.
A pleasant, friendly, good-natured manner; an affable and approachable disposition; good-heartedness.
Friendly atmosphere; an atmosphere of good cheer.
A cheerful remark.
The situation of a player who has committed enough fouls to be almost at the point of fouling out and disqualification.
Lacking restraint, or ignoring societal standards, particularly in sexual conduct.
Disregarding accepted rules.
A fine-grained homogeneous sedimentary rock composed of clay or volcanic ash which has been metamorphosed so that it cleaves easily into thin layers.
The bluish-grey colour of most slate.
A chalkboard, sheet of slate for writing on with chalk or with a thin rod of slate (a slate pencil) formerly commonly used by both students and teachers in schools
A roofing-tile made of slate.
A record of money owed.
definitions.example: Put it on my slate – I’ll pay you next week.

definitions.definition: A list of affiliated candidates for an election.
definitions.example: Roy Disney led the alternative slate of directors for the stockholder vote.

definitions.definition: An artificial material resembling slate and used for the same purposes.
A thin plate of any material; a flake.
Having the bluish-grey/gray colour of slate.
To cover with slate.
definitions.example: The old church ledgers show that the roof was slated in 1775.

definitions.definition: To criticise harshly.
definitions.example: The play was slated by the critics.

definitions.definition: To schedule.
definitions.example: The election was slated for November 2nd.

definitions.definition: To anticipate or strongly expect.
definitions.example: The next version of our software is slated to be the best release ever.

definitions.definition: To set a dog upon (a person).
The index finger: the first finger next to the thumb.
The action of rubbing, kneading or hitting someone's body, to help the person relax, prepare for muscular action (as in contact sports) or to relieve aches.
definitions.example: Having a massage can have many beneficial effects.

definitions.definition: To rub and knead (someone's body or a part of a body), to perform a massage on (somebody).
To manipulate (data, a document etc.) to make it more presentable or more convenient to work with.
To falsify (data or accounts).
Anything light, soft or fuzzy, especially fur, hair, feathers.
Anything inconsequential or superficial.
definitions.example: That article was basically a bunch of fluff. It didn't say anything substantive.

definitions.definition: A lapse or mistake, especially a mistake in an actor's lines.
Marshmallow creme.
definitions.example: That New England-style salami and fluff sandwich sure hit the spot!

definitions.definition: A passive partner in a lesbian relationship.
A fart.
To make something fluffy.
definitions.example: The cat fluffed its tail.

definitions.definition: To become fluffy, puff up.
To move lightly like fluff.
(of an actor or announcer) To make a mistake in one's lines.
To do incorrectly, for example mishit, miskick, miscue etc.
To fart.
To arouse (a male pornographic actor) before filming.
The text of a dramatic musical work, such as an opera.
A book containing such a text.
One of the triune goddesses of the Lady in Wicca alongside the Crone and Mother representing a girl or a young woman
A girl or an unmarried young woman.
A female virgin.
definitions.example: She's unmarried and still a maiden.

definitions.definition: A man with no experience of sex, especially because of deliberate abstention.
A maidservant.
A clothes maiden.
An unmarried woman, especially an older woman.
A racehorse without any victory, i.e. one having a "virgin record".
A horse race in which all starters are maidens.
A Scottish counterpart of the guillotine.
A maiden over.
A machine for washing linen.
Virgin.
(of a female, human or animal) Without offspring.
Like or befitting a (young, unmarried) maiden.
Being a first occurrence or event.
definitions.example: After Edmund Burke's maiden speech, William Pitt the Elder said Burke had "spoken in such a manner as to stop the mouths of all Europe" and that the Commons should congratulate itself on acquiring such a member.

definitions.definition: Being an over in which no runs are scored.
Fresh; innocent; unpolluted; pure; hitherto unused.
(of a fortress) Never having been captured or violated.
(of a tree) Grown from seed and never pruned
(heading) Anything that rolls.
A long wide bandage used in surgery.
A large, wide, curling wave that falls back on itself as it breaks on a coast.
(heading) A bird.
A police patrol car or patrolman (rather than an unmarked police car or a detective)
A padded surcingle that is used on horses for training and vaulting.
A roll of titles or (especially) credits played over film or video; television or film credits.
A wheelchair user.
To roller skate.
To subject a person to a means test, or to require a means test in order to receive a benefit
The cap that closes the opening of a tank, e.g. the fuel tank of a car, from which the tank can be filled.
Any solid object rounded at one end and tapering on the other, possibly attached to a larger object at the tapered end.
definitions.example: the bulb of the aorta

definitions.definition: A light bulb.
The bulb-shaped root portion of a plant such as a tulip, from which the rest of the plant may be regrown.
A bulbous protuberance at the forefoot of certain vessels to reduce turbulence.
The medulla oblongata.
To take the shape of a bulb; to swell.
Provided with insufficient nourishment to sustain proper health and growth.
An appliance or room used to store food or other perishable items at temperatures below 0° Celsius (32° Fahrenheit).
The section of a refrigerator used to store food or other perishable items at a temperature below 0° Celsius (32° Fahrenheit).
(Parkinson's disease) A Parkinson's disease patient that experiences freezing of gait (FOG) episodes.
A white man living outside of a white settlement.
A trainee station manager or owner, working as a stockman or farm hand; formerly, a young man of independent means working at a station in a supernumerary capacity to gain experience.
To work as a jackaroo.
definitions.example: Bill has gone jackarooing out west.

definitions.definition: A steam-powered vessel propelled by one or two paddle wheels

(sometimes capitalized) The doctrines of Plato's academy; specifically the skeptical doctrines of the later academy stating that nothing can be known; a tenet of the Academic philosophy; state of being Academic.
Traditional or orthodox formalism; conventionalism.
Speculative thoughts and attitudes.
A mannerism or mode peculiar to an academy.
An academic course intended to equip students with the skills they need in order to take further courses.

A period of play in which members of a visiting baseball team attempt to hit a baseball pitched by the opposing home team until three players are called out, followed by a similar attempt by members of the home baseball team against the visiting team's pitching. There are nine or more innings in a regulation baseball game.
definitions.example: It is a baseball tradition to sing "Take Me Out To the Ball Game" during the seventh inning stretch.

definitions.definition: A similar period of play.
definitions.example: We batted around in our half of the inning.

definitions.definition: A player (or team)'s turn at the table to make shots until ended by a miss or a foul.
A chance or opportunity to perform some deed or act.
definitions.example: We are in just the second inning of our quest to enter this new market.

definitions.definition: The gathering of a crop; harvesting.
Lands recovered from the sea.
To house; to lodge.
To take lodging; to lodge.
The official time in a particular region or time zone.
definitions.example: The race starts at 15.00 local time on Saturday.

definitions.definition: A test required in order to acquire a driver's licence.
A close physical union of two objects.
Faithful support for some cause.
An extent to which a patient continues an agreed treatment plan.
The unconscious impulsive component of the personality in the Freudian psychoanalytic model.
A freshwater fish of the family Cyprinidae, found across northern Europe and Asia, especially Leuciscus idus.
Identifier.
Used in citations to state that the citation is to the work immediately previously cited.
The condition of being repossessed
The act of repossessing
An alkaloid (C10H14N2), commonly occurring in the tobacco plant. In small doses it is a habit-forming stimulant; in larger doses it is toxic and is often used in insecticides.
Tobacco, cigarettes
definitions.example: He is addicted to nicotine.

definitions.definition: A miscellaneous collection of different things; a miscellany.
A miscellany.
The fulfillment of one's own abilities or capacities, self-actualization.
The direct experience of being, in relation to one's inner nature as an unbounded creator of one's reality.
A realization about oneself
Any of 43 species of squirrels, most from the tribe Pteromyini, others from family Anomaluridae, which glide from tree to tree.
An extraordinary thing seen as an omen; a portent.
An extraordinary occurrence or creature; an anomaly, especially a monster; a freak.
An amazing or marvellous thing; a wonder.
A wonderful example of something.
An extremely talented person, especially a child.
The style in which someone's hair has been cut and arranged.
The state of being a saint
Saints collectively
A perpetual tan.
(temperature) Between warm and cool.
definitions.example: My curry is lukewarm.

definitions.definition: Not very enthusiastic (about a proposal or an idea).
definitions.example: The suggestion met with only a lukewarm response.

definitions.definition: An expression in which the eyes are partly closed.
The look of eyes which are turned in different directions, as in strabismus.
definitions.example: He looks handsome although he's got a slight squint.

definitions.definition: A quick or sideways glance.
A short look.
A hagioscope.
(radio transmission) The angle by which the transmission signal is offset from the normal of a phased array antenna.
To look with the eyes partly closed, as in bright sunlight, or as a threatening expression.
definitions.example: The children squinted to frighten each other.

definitions.definition: To look or glance sideways.
To look with, or have eyes that are turned in different directions; to suffer from strabismus.
To have an indirect bearing, reference, or implication; to have an allusion to, or inclination towards, something.
To be not quite straight, off-centred; to deviate from a true line; to run obliquely.
To turn to an oblique position; to direct obliquely.
definitions.example: to squint an eye

definitions.definition: Looking obliquely; having the vision distorted.
Askew, not level
A mammary gland, teat.
(chiefly in the plural) A woman's breast.
An idiot; a fool.
definitions.example: Look at that tit driving on the wrong side of the road!

definitions.definition: A police officer; a "tithead".
A light blow or hit (now usually in the phrase tit for tat).
To strike lightly, tap, pat.
To taunt, to reproach.
A chickadee; a small passerine bird of the genus Parus or the family Paridae, common in the Northern Hemisphere.
Any of various other small passerine birds.
A small horse; a nag.
A young girl, later especially a minx, hussy.
A morsel; a bit.
A person who retails groceries (foodstuffs and household items) from a grocery.
To sell groceries; to act as a grocer.
A wing attached to the hull of a ship that raises it out of the water when travelling at speed and thus reduces drag.
A vessel equipped with such a device.
The birth of a dead fetus; the delivery of an infant which is dead at birth.
(modern medicine) The birth of a dead fetus after 20 weeks of gestation.
A game of chance similar to bingo
A lottery
A person who is intransigent.
Unwilling to compromise or moderate a position; unreasonable
definitions.example: Don't waste your time trying to change his mind: he's completely intransigent.

definitions.definition: To be suitable for.
definitions.example: It fits the purpose.

definitions.definition: To conform to in size and shape.
definitions.example: If I lose a few kilos, the gorgeous wedding dress might fit me.

definitions.definition: To be of the right size and shape
definitions.example: I wanted to borrow my little sister's jeans, but they didn't fit.

definitions.definition: (with to) To make conform in size and shape.
definitions.example: I want to fit the drapes to the windows.

definitions.definition: To be in agreement with.
definitions.example: These definitions fit most of the usage.

definitions.definition: To adjust.
definitions.example: The regression program fit a line to the data.

definitions.definition: To attach, especially when requiring exact positioning or sizing.
To equip or supply.
definitions.example: The chandler will fit us with provisions for a month.

definitions.definition: To make ready.
definitions.example: I'm fitting the ship for a summer sail home.

definitions.definition: To be seemly.
To be proper or becoming.
To be in harmony.
definitions.example: The paint, the fabrics, the rugs all fit.

definitions.definition: To suffer a fit.
A small part, especially a standardized or detachable part of a device or machine.
A tube connector; a standardized connecting part of a piping system to attach sections of pipe together, such as a coupling
The act of trying on clothes to inspect or adjust the fit.
The process of fitting up; especially of applying craft methods such as skilled filing to the making and assembling of machines or other products.

(often plural) A removable item in a house or other building, which can be taken with one when one moves out, such as a moveable piece of furniture, a carpet, picture, etc.; US furnishing; compare fixture.
definitions.example: the fittings of a church or study

definitions.definition: The action or condition of having fits in the sense of seizures or convulsions.
definitions.example: Since her medication was changed, her fitting has got worse.

definitions.definition: Ready, appropriate, suitable, or in keeping
To break apart and fall down suddenly; to cave in.
To cease to function due to a sudden breakdown; to fail suddenly and completely.
definitions.example: Pyramid schemes tend to generate profits for a while and then collapse.

definitions.definition: To fold compactly.
To hide additional directory (folder) levels below the selected directory (folder) levels. When a folder contains no additional folders, a minus sign (-) appears next to the folder.
For several batsmen to get out in quick succession
To cause something to collapse.
definitions.example: Hurry up and collapse the tent so we can get moving.

definitions.definition: To pass out and fall to the floor or ground, as from exhaustion or other illness; to faint.
definitions.example: The exhausted singer collapsed on stage and had to be taken to the hospital.

definitions.definition: An instrument or device for domestic use, especially in the kitchen.
definitions.example: We have convenient storage for all the kitchen utensils.

definitions.definition: A useful small tool, implement, or vessel.
definitions.example: He stocked up on old-style writing utensils.

definitions.definition: The insertion of needles into the (living) tissue of the body, especially for purposes of pain relief.
To treat with acupuncture.
A form of boules originating from the south of France.
